trans-unit.source: Install the Storage client for Windows Store apps
trans-unit.target: Install the Storage client for Windows Store apps

trans-unit.source: To be able to use an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, search for `WindowsAzure.Storage`, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, search for `WindowsAzure.Storage`, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.

trans-unit.source: Update the quickstart client app to capture and upload images
trans-unit.target: Update the quickstart client app to capture and upload images

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file for the Windows app project and in the **Capabilities** tab enable the **Webcam** and **Microphone** capabilities.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file for the Windows app project and in the **Capabilities** tab enable the **Webcam** and **Microphone** capabilities.

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that your app can use a camera attached to the computer.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that your app can use a camera attached to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Users will be requested to allow camera access the first time that the app is run.
trans-unit.target: Users will be requested to allow camera access the first time that the app is run.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the step above for the Windows Phone app project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the step above for the Windows Phone app project.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows app project, open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the **StackPanel** element directly after the first **QuickStartTask** element with the following code:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows app project, open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the **StackPanel** element directly after the first **QuickStartTask** element with the following code:

trans-unit.source: Replace the **StackPanel** element in the **DataTemplate** with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **StackPanel** element in the **DataTemplate** with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This adds an image to the **ItemTemplate** and sets its binding source as the URI of the uploaded image in the Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: This adds an image to the **ItemTemplate** and sets its binding source as the URI of the uploaded image in the Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: In the Windows Phone app project, open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the **ButtonSave** element with the following code:
trans-unit.target: In the Windows Phone app project, open the MainPage.xaml file and replace the **ButtonSave** element with the following code:

trans-unit.source: Replace the **StackPanel** element in the **DataTemplate** with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **StackPanel** element in the **DataTemplate** with the following code:

trans-unit.source: In the shared DataModel folder, open the TodoItem.cs project file and add add the following properties to the TodoItem class:
trans-unit.target: In the shared DataModel folder, open the TodoItem.cs project file and add add the following properties to the TodoItem class:

trans-unit.source: Open the shared MainPage.cs project file and add the following **using** statements:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared MainPage.cs project file and add the following **using** statements:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the MainPage class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the MainPage class:

trans-unit.source: This code displays the UI used to capture an image, and saves the image to a storage file.
trans-unit.target: This code displays the UI used to capture an image, and saves the image to a storage file.

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing `InsertTodoItem` method with the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing `InsertTodoItem` method with the following code:

trans-unit.source: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: This code sends a request to the mobile service to insert a new TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to upload the image from local storage to Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the SAS, which is then used to upload the image from local storage to Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the uploaded image is used in data binding.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the uploaded image is used in data binding.

trans-unit.source: The final step is to test both versions of the app and validate that uploads succeed from both devices.
trans-unit.target: The final step is to test both versions of the app and validate that uploads succeed from both devices.

trans-unit.source: Test uploading the images in your app
trans-unit.target: Test uploading the images in your app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, make sure that the Windows project is set as the default project, then press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, make sure that the Windows project is set as the default project, then press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: Enter text in the textbox under **Insert a TodoItem**, then click **Photo**.
trans-unit.target: Enter text in the textbox under **Insert a TodoItem**, then click **Photo**.

trans-unit.source: Click or tap the preview to take a picture, then click **Upload** to insert the new item and upload the image.
trans-unit.target: Click or tap the preview to take a picture, then click **Upload** to insert the new item and upload the image.

trans-unit.source: The new item, along with the uploaded image, is displayed in the list view.
trans-unit.target: The new item, along with the uploaded image, is displayed in the list view.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The image is downloaded automatically from Blob storage when the *imageUri* property of the new item is bound to the **Image** control.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The image is downloaded automatically from Blob storage when the *imageUri* property of the new item is bound to the **Image** control.

trans-unit.source: Stop the app and restart the Windows Phone project version of the app.
trans-unit.target: Stop the app and restart the Windows Phone project version of the app.

trans-unit.source: The previously uploaded image is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The previously uploaded image is displayed.

trans-unit.source: As before, enter some text in the textbox, then click **Photo**.
trans-unit.target: As before, enter some text in the textbox, then click **Photo**.

trans-unit.source: Tap the preview to take a picture, then click **Upload** to insert the new item and upload the image.
trans-unit.target: Tap the preview to take a picture, then click **Upload** to insert the new item and upload the image.

trans-unit.source: You have completed the upload images tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You have completed the upload images tutorial.
